alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:10AM EST until December 19 at 12:06PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Presumpscot River at West Falmouth. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding affects storage yards of industrial businesses on Warren Avenue in Westbrook. Property should be relocated to places which are 5 feet higher than nearby river banks to avoid being flooded or isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Tuesday was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 5.6 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
